page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: A bus is a vehicle which carries fare paying passengers to varying destinations. The{SYPTE (South {Yorkshire Passenger Transport {Executive)}and{Yorkshire Traction operate in the Warmsworth area employing approximately 829 people. Yorkshire Traction operate a two shift day and SYPTE a three shift day. Both companies have low fares. SYPTE has half its fares paid from the rates. Yorkshire Traction keeps low fares by less staff and fewer buses. The buses are used for about three years, at present costing Â£7 000 to replace. The companies have nine and six garages respectively. Of the companies Yorkshire Traction has the only self service machines. SYPTE's new vehicles carry 82 people, and Yorkshire Traction's 80 passengers. Both companies carry advertising.
